title: go-mode: godef-jump can't handle Windows path name
body:
by **zombie.fml**: 
I'm running Emacs 24.3.1 on Windows 7.

godef-jump assumes the output of godef is `filename:line:column' which is okay on *nix
systems. But Windows path names contain an extra `:' right after the drive letter which
can cause problems when splitting the output into components.

I included a patch which uses regex to find the right filename.

Tested on my Windows PC, I don't have access to *nix systems. Sorry for that.
Attachments: 1. go-mode.diff (1071 bytes)
